intro: Diosma asperifolia, commonly known as the roughleaf diosma, is a flowering plant belonging to the Solanaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile, where it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. The plant features hairy, often rough-textured leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale blue. Its fruit is a dry capsule containing several seeds, and it is adapted to survive in arid conditions. Diosma asperifolia is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
